intro: Agrostophyllum inocephalum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant typically features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. Agrostophyllum inocephalum is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
